After a stint in the Irish Guards, I moved to London to pursue a career in acting. It wasn't easy, of course – I worked multiple jobs to make ends meet, including stints as a taxi driver, a nightclub bouncer, and even a factory worker. But I persisted, landing small roles here and there before landing my breakthrough part in Steven Spielberg's 1993 film, "Schindler's List."

These days, I divide my time between Los Angeles, New York City, and my family's ancestral home in County Armagh. When I'm not working, you can find me hiking in the mountains, playing the bodhran, or enjoying a good Guinness with friends and family. Cheers, world!
